item.description:
Please RSVP!

This meeting is the first Tuesday evening meeting using the expanded discussion format. Instead of a feature speaker we will have two new discussion centered dialogs. They are:

What's Hot and What's Not led by Tom Hill

Tom will lead a discussion on what trends - and associated stock tickers - are distinctly good for longs or shorts. The focus will be on ETFs and stocks for asset classes, sectors, industry groups and indexes. In particular, we will be looking to hear from you to find out what you have surmised and found a way to trade on it.

Prospecting Using Investors.Com led by Jeff Orrik

Jeff will use Investors.com and the Premium package to prospect for stocks. The goal is to find stocks and ETFs at buy points while experimenting with the tools available on Investors.Com and using the various talents of everybody in the room.

In addition we will continue with our regular features:

Harlan's Market Update led by Harlan Rieur

Harlan gives us his live market analysis on market trends. Using StockCharts.com and his own combination of indicators - Bollinger Bands, stochastic RSI, MACD, Williams%, OBV plus his panoply of moving averages. Always a pleasure for everyone!

StockPicks led by Chris Jones - New and Improved!

Eric announces which stocks performed best. Then we solicit all the picks from everyone and run through all them, with Jeff putting up the charts as we have done in the past. Afterwards we will focus on 5 of the stocks to be analyzed by Sandy and dissected by the group at large. If any time remains, Chris will pick an industry or sector to brainstorm.

Premeeting Period is the Daytraders Meeting led by Eric Eklof

The Premeeting starts at 5:30 and runs until 6:50. Everyone is welcome!

Building on the enthusiasm created by his Daytrading Talk, plus his effusive personality during the meetings, Eric Eklof is starting a Daytraders Group. Come be part of the startup of this group! Everyone is welcome!


Agenda:
5:30-6:50 Premeeting Period
- Daytraders Group led by Eric
7:00 - Meeting Begins:
- Announcements and Polls, led by Doug
- Harlan's Market Update led by Harlan
- StockPicks led by Chris
- What's Hot and What's Not led by Tom
- Prospecting Using Investors.com led by Jeff

Our members value discussion highly. We try to pack as much discussion as possible. Expressing ideas and sharing knowledge is paramount to our members.
All levels of expertise are welcome. No question is too simple - as a matter of fact the simplest question often evokes the best discussion!

Newcomers gather at the podium during the 8:00 break to learn about the group. Welcome!

If you talk stocks with someone then bring them with you!

To join our online discussion go to
http://groups.google....
or send email to DouglasWRoberts@gmail.com.

The Virtual Trading game is up and running! Directions are at:
http://groups.google....
Note: Please be sure to choose a name that we can identify with you! Otherwise it is anonymous!

If you have a friend you talk stocks with, bring them with you!

Food or drinks are not allowed in any MIT meeting room.

We strongly urge each person to make his or her own decisions about investing their money. Investment ideas and recommendations made during our meetings and in our online dialogs bear no liability by anyone.

This is a free and open meeting. No membership is required, but please RSVP.
item.name: Boston Investor's Business Daily Tuesday Meetup
